alert.note: Alert for Bradford (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 01 at 11:28PM EDT until July 02 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Bradford County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 200 AM EDT. * At 1128 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated another cluster of thunderstorms producing heavy rain moving across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain has already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Canton, Wyalusing, New Albany, Overton, Franklindale, Monroeton, South Branch, Le Roy, Sugar Run, Grover, West Franklin, Wilmot, Hollenback, Monroe, Alba, Evergreen, Liberty Corners, Durell, West Le Roy and Terrytown. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
